p.s: I would agree with Worne's claim that language learning is vital for the UK's future prosperity and global standing.
I think English as only language which one can speak isn't enough especially, because nobody knows how long English will be that dominant as global language as they use nowadays.
Another point is that, as Worne also mentioned in his article, employers who have language skills added to their specialist skills are more in demand as employers who only have specialist skills.
This combination gives someone better chances to get a job and it's also a big advantage for someone in the competition of a place of work.
The point that everyone speaks ENglish in the world is not that good in my opinion.
Just because nearly everyone in the world speaks English that don'tdoesn't mean that the native English speaker can communicate with everyone.
Of course it's aan advantage but it would be better if they also could speak another languages.
